GOD.content: Unheimlichkeit of Geheimnis, both Freud & Heidegger [see SPOM pp. 218-19]: beyond an axiomatic of the self or the chez soi as ego cogito
GOD.linkedContent: Unheimlichkeit of Geheimnis, both Freud & Heidegger [see SPOM pp. 218-19]: beyond an axiomatic of the self or the chez soi as ego cogito

FK.content: quasi-spontaneous automaticity: confused identity, auto-immunity, auto-indemnify > detaches & reattaches (to family, proper) at same time, mystical or secret mechanicity: unheimlich
FK.linkedContent: quasi-spontaneous automaticity: confused identity, auto-immunity, auto-indemnify > detaches & reattaches (to family, proper) at same time, mystical or secret mechanicity: unheimlich

H.content: p. anne 136 deconstruction leads to uncanny at heart of the most familiar, where “all we had seen was fire”
H.linkedContent: p. anne 136 deconstruction leads to uncanny at heart of the most familiar, where “all we had seen was fire”

S.content: doesn’t the having-of-world for man include an unheimliche privation of world (like the animal)
S.linkedContent: doesn’t the having-of-world for man include an unheimliche privation of world (like the animal)

AF.content: uncontrollable undecidability in axiomatics of both Freud & Heidegger when they use the word unheimlich
AF.linkedContent: uncontrollable undecidability in axiomatics of both Freud & Heidegger when they use the word unheimlich

SPOM.content: “I am” = “I am haunted,” Ego = ghost; Es Spukt (translation misses impersonal, quasi-anonymity of German), “it spooks,” “it ghosts,” it specters,” ego inhabited by its specter
SPOM.linkedContent: “I am” = “I am haunted,” Ego = ghost; Es Spukt (translation misses impersonal, quasi-anonymity of German), “it spooks,” “it ghosts,” it specters,” ego inhabited by its specter

SPOM.content: “es spukt” in Freud’s “Das Unheimliche,” production of figure the revenant (der Spuk)
SPOM.linkedContent: “es spukt” in Freud’s “Das Unheimliche,” production of figure the revenant (der Spuk)

SPOM.content: man, most unheimlich of all ghosts, if Christ (absolute specter) causes fear and pain, man causes even more—man makes himself fear (se fait peur), becomes fear he inspires > thus contradictions of all humanism
SPOM.linkedContent: man, most unheimlich of all ghosts, if Christ (absolute specter) causes fear and pain, man causes even more—man makes himself fear (se fait peur), becomes fear he inspires > thus contradictions of all humanism

SPOM.content: unheimlich: word of irreducible haunting or obsession

figure of absolute hospitality: strange, familiar, inhospitable > quasi-transcendental “messianism,” materialism w/out substance, materialism of the khōra for a despairing “messianism,” a curious taste of death, a foretaste (avant-goût), curious of what it conjures
SPOM.linkedContent: figure of absolute hospitality: strange, familiar, inhospitable > quasi-transcendental “messianism,” materialism w/out substance, materialism of the khōra for a despairing “messianism,” a curious taste of death, a foretaste (avant-goût), curious of what it conjures

SPOM.content: if “es spukt” is strongest example of Unheimlichkeit, as Freud admits, can it be reduced to an example, is it not the Thing, cause of history or epistemē, exemplary force?
SPOM.linkedContent: if “es spukt” is strongest example of Unheimlichkeit, as Freud admits, can it be reduced to an example, is it not the Thing, cause of history or epistemē, exemplary force?

SPOM.content: Freud’s conjuring mechanism: even though “es spukt” strongest example of Unheimlichkeit, one can’t begin there because on se fait trop peur, heimliche-unheimliche becomes undecidable
SPOM.linkedContent: Freud’s conjuring mechanism: even though “es spukt” strongest example of Unheimlichkeit, one can’t begin there because on se fait trop peur, heimliche-unheimliche becomes undecidable

A.content: Dasein takes shelter from standing before oneself [in anxiety of death] in gossip (Gerede), far from Unheimlichkeit, structural not accidental modes of Verfallen
A.linkedContent: Dasein takes shelter from standing before oneself [in anxiety of death] in gossip (Gerede), far from Unheimlichkeit, structural not accidental modes of Verfallen

POOF.content: Heidegger’s Stimmung changes everything, beyond the concept, suspends/terrifies oppositions, where truth & untruth are together equiprimordially (gleichursprunglich) > Unheimlichkeit, lodges enemy in heart of every friend
POOF.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Stimmung changes everything, beyond the concept, suspends/terrifies oppositions, where truth & untruth are together equiprimordially (gleichursprunglich) > Unheimlichkeit, lodges enemy in heart of every friend

POOF.content: unheimlich enters into the most familiar, lodges enemy into heart of friend, a form of welcome that recalls the haunt as much as the home (l’habitat), hearth, oikeiótēs
POOF.linkedContent: unheimlich enters into the most familiar, lodges enemy into heart of friend, a form of welcome that recalls the haunt as much as the home (l’habitat), hearth, oikeiótēs

POOF.content: if Aristotle says a friend is ‘one soul in two bodies,’ the friend has no home, no proper body, a visitor, traveller, guest, unheimlich (translated into Greek as atópos, mad?) > what would this say of the principle of convenance, which elsewhere defines political—in its bond to friendship [?]
POOF.linkedContent: if Aristotle says a friend is ‘one soul in two bodies,’ the friend has no home, no proper body, a visitor, traveller, guest, unheimlich (translated into Greek as atópos, mad?) > what would this say of the principle of convenance, which elsewhere defines political—in its bond to friendship [?]

DS.content: Derrida always returning to Freud’s Das Unheimliche (1919)—double, repetition, blurring of borders btwn “imagination” & “reality,” “symbol” & “thing it symbolizes”
DS.linkedContent: Derrida always returning to Freud’s Das Unheimliche (1919)—double, repetition, blurring of borders btwn “imagination” & “reality,” “symbol” & “thing it symbolizes”

DS.content: (to be continued) in The Uncanny, Freud is most attentive to undecidable ambivalence, play of double, though he separates fictional uncanny from the feeling itself
DS.linkedContent: (to be continued) in The Uncanny, Freud is most attentive to undecidable ambivalence, play of double, though he separates fictional uncanny from the feeling itself

OTO.content: the ear is uncanny, can become double, large or small; Freud says the infant can’t close it
OTO.linkedContent: the ear is uncanny, can become double, large or small; Freud says the infant can’t close it

OTO.content: the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny
OTO.linkedContent: the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny

ATIA.content: trembling, dizzy, uncanny, vertigo, “Schwindel ist unheimlich,” in Heidegger’s description of animal and world
ATIA.linkedContent: trembling, dizzy, uncanny, vertigo, “Schwindel ist unheimlich,” in Heidegger’s description of animal and world

DPi.content: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious
DPi.linkedContent: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious

DPi.content: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary
DPi.linkedContent: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary

REST.content: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself
REST.linkedContent: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself

REST.content: certain thinking/experience of nothingness (nonexistent) is required to question being of existent, and the difference of being and existent
REST.linkedContent: certain thinking/experience of nothingness (nonexistent) is required to question being of existent, and the difference of being and existent

REST.content: for Heidegger, cette pensée du néant alien to science, which deals only w/ existents: belongs to philosophy/poetry > nonexistent, there w/out being there as being present, a kind of haunting: Unhemlichekeit is condition of question of being, pivot (cheville) of the essence (see OS)
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, cette pensée du néant alien to science, which deals only w/ existents: belongs to philosophy/poetry > nonexistent, there w/out being there as being present, a kind of haunting: Unhemlichekeit is condition of question of being, pivot (cheville) of the essence (see OS)

RM.content: when Heidegger says “House of Being,” it’s less so the house can determine Being, more so we can rethink the house
RM.linkedContent: when Heidegger says “House of Being,” it’s less so the house can determine Being, more so we can rethink the house

RM.content: this is an unheimlich maneuver, not pure inversion, outside the familial transport of colloquial metaphor (rethinks economic value & the proper, not a judicative statement: “S is P”)
RM.linkedContent: this is an unheimlich maneuver, not pure inversion, outside the familial transport of colloquial metaphor (rethinks economic value & the proper, not a judicative statement: “S is P”)

EL.content: secularization as a sacrifice of language, destruction of sacred language as experience of sacred language (perhaps most unheimlich experience), but also sacrifice of sacrifice: self-destruction of sacrificial function/operation (which presupposes sacredness)
EL.linkedContent: secularization as a sacrifice of language, destruction of sacred language as experience of sacred language (perhaps most unheimlich experience), but also sacrifice of sacrifice: self-destruction of sacrificial function/operation (which presupposes sacredness)

HST.content: Valéry [in Monsieur Teste] tries to neutralize/master Unheimlichkeit [see BSi pp. 200-01 in CAP(ITAL)]
HST.linkedContent: Valéry [in Monsieur Teste] tries to neutralize/master Unheimlichkeit [see BSi pp. 200-01 in CAP(ITAL)]

HST.content: via Celan, art as unheimlich, containing the inhuman: Medusa, monkey, automata, marionette
HST.linkedContent: via Celan, art as unheimlich, containing the inhuman: Medusa, monkey, automata, marionette

HST.content: unheimlich: 1) worrying aspect of foreignness as intimacy of one’s own home 2) says the essential bearing of Celan’s “Meridian” 3) associated w/ the foreigner 4) Geheimnis (the intimate, the folded back on itself, what has withdrawn in withdrawal, hidden inside of house and home), secret of encounter at most intimate heart of present
HST.linkedContent: unheimlich: 1) worrying aspect of foreignness as intimacy of one’s own home 2) says the essential bearing of Celan’s “Meridian” 3) associated w/ the foreigner 4) Geheimnis (the intimate, the folded back on itself, what has withdrawn in withdrawal, hidden inside of house and home), secret of encounter at most intimate heart of present

HST.content: Unheimlichkeit just as important for Heidegger as for Freud (but scarcely pointed out)
HST.linkedContent: Unheimlichkeit just as important for Heidegger as for Freud (but scarcely pointed out)

HST.content: Heidegger translates Antigone’s deinon (usually translated as violent, terrible) as un-heimlich ——acc. Heidegger, man is the most unheimlich—steps out of usual frontiers (Grenzen) of habit > man’s Grundzug (fundamental feature): being foreign to everything familiar
HST.linkedContent: Heidegger translates Antigone’s deinon (usually translated as violent, terrible) as un-heimlich ——acc. Heidegger, man is the most unheimlich—steps out of usual frontiers (Grenzen) of habit > man’s Grundzug (fundamental feature): being foreign to everything familiar

HST.content: Heidegger doesn’t say “there’s nothing proper to man,” but that the property of what is appropriated is strange, unfamiliar to interior of home
HST.linkedContent: Heidegger doesn’t say “there’s nothing proper to man,” but that the property of what is appropriated is strange, unfamiliar to interior of home

SPEC.content: Beyond… and Das Unheimliche: devil comes back neither as imaginary representation, nor as an apparition in person: devil comes back “in person” to double his double…a doubling doubling his double, devil overflows his double at moment he’s nothing but his double
SPEC.linkedContent: Beyond… and Das Unheimliche: devil comes back neither as imaginary representation, nor as an apparition in person: devil comes back “in person” to double his double…a doubling doubling his double, devil overflows his double at moment he’s nothing but his double

SPEC.content: dialectics acquits itself [allays uneasiness] of double, opposes mask to original “in person”
SPEC.linkedContent: dialectics acquits itself [allays uneasiness] of double, opposes mask to original “in person”

SPEC.content: visitation of devil, apparition of “thing in itself,” over & above representative that’s supposed to supplement him, supplement of its “own supplement”: expands double-effects, upsets appeasing order of representation, duplicity w/out original > for Rousseau, diabolical brings fright to a climax
SPEC.linkedContent: visitation of devil, apparition of “thing in itself,” over & above representative that’s supposed to supplement him, supplement of its “own supplement”: expands double-effects, upsets appeasing order of representation, duplicity w/out original > for Rousseau, diabolical brings fright to a climax

SPEC.content: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices
SPEC.linkedContent: “literary fiction” in fort:da, fait-oeuvre in abyss of these repetitions, fairies, demons, unheimlich repetitions, what is most gripping (saisissant) and ungraspable (insaisissable) about Beyond…, for Freud too, who believed he could affix the seal of the Freuds to it [Beyond…] while hearing voices

FV.content: even Freud [thus not Lacan] indicates, in Das Unheimliche, literary fiction’s resistance to general law of psychoanalytic knowledge
FV.linkedContent: even Freud [thus not Lacan] indicates, in Das Unheimliche, literary fiction’s resistance to general law of psychoanalytic knowledge

FV.content: Lacan forecloses the double w/out mercy, contains it in the imaginary > imaginary/symbolic duality controls Unheimlichkeit, the anguishing disarray (l’affolement angoissant) (w/out hope of closure, reappropriation, or truth) provoked by references (renvois) from simulacrum to simulacrum, double to double
FV.linkedContent: Lacan forecloses the double w/out mercy, contains it in the imaginary > imaginary/symbolic duality controls Unheimlichkeit, the anguishing disarray (l’affolement angoissant) (w/out hope of closure, reappropriation, or truth) provoked by references (renvois) from simulacrum to simulacrum, double to double

FV.content: analysand seeing his/her double: “uncontrollable anxiety” disrupts every verification of identity, obstacle for transference
FV.linkedContent: analysand seeing his/her double: “uncontrollable anxiety” disrupts every verification of identity, obstacle for transference

FV.content: [re: narrator identifying w/ Dupin in Purloined…] if dual relation btwn 2 doubles overflows & simulates symbolic: opposition imaginary/symbolic has little pertinence
FV.linkedContent: [re: narrator identifying w/ Dupin in Purloined…] if dual relation btwn 2 doubles overflows & simulates symbolic: opposition imaginary/symbolic has little pertinence

FV.content: position of each character identifies itself w/ the other & divides itself: even the position du mort (dummy) and of a supplementary 4th [beyond triangle] [all characters occupy all positions]
FV.linkedContent: position of each character identifies itself w/ the other & divides itself: even the position du mort (dummy) and of a supplementary 4th [beyond triangle] [all characters occupy all positions]

FV.content: double, Unheimlichkeit, doesn’t belong to triad, triangle carried into a labyrinth of doubles, w/out original, fac-similes
FV.linkedContent: double, Unheimlichkeit, doesn’t belong to triad, triangle carried into a labyrinth of doubles, w/out original, fac-similes
